instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light.
threads.message:
Hi, there is a mbp with no green light but, if i connect a charged battery this have a regular functionality. 
No visible water damage.. nothing.



Here my measures:


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 12.25v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_T29BST</SIGNAL>  :  0v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> : 12.24v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> : 12.24v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> : 16.40v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> : @ Pin 12 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 3.48v 

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> : 3.48v


<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> : 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> : 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> : 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> : 0.02v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> : 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> : 0v 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> : 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> : 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> : 0v


<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> Measures:


<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>: 
Pin 5: 0.78v
Pin 1: 0v
Pin 4: 0v


<CHIP>U6901</CHIP>
Pin 1: 0.62v
Pin 5: 3.48v
Pin 4: 0v


<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
Pin 12: 3.48v
Pin 14: 0.62v 
Pin 4: 3.48v
Pin 2: 16.40v
Pin 3: 4v

Trying to solve the green light, change the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> a couple of timesâ€¦ without a good result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light.
threads.message: No S5 rails, no green light, no <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>.... Maybe SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light.
threads.message: PPBUS is 12.25... SMCs not coming on. What is SMC <SIGNAL>RESET_L</SIGNAL> measuring?

threads.message:

<SIGNAL>SMS_RESET_L</SIGNAL> have 3.45v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light.
threads.message: Reflow SMC first, if that does not help replace it from identical donor board.
